Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; bevelled rim; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired red) below; trace of possible rosette above single band in added white; exterior: thin bands immediately below rim above tongue frieze; below, frieze of dotted rectangles flanked by pairs of vertical strokes; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx (top of head and part of curlicue remaining), to right; pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd almost certainly belongs to the same vase as Heidelberg I47.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0509) (phase 2)
